00017 struct wi_window {
00018     struct w_window w;
00019     int oysize; /* old y-size (when window is shrunk) */
00020     int ixpos, iypos, ixsize, iysize; /* init-position&size */
00021     int win_contents; /* 1 if contents shown, 0 otherwise */
00022     int drawn; /* 1 if window is drawn, 0 otherwise */
00023     int in_refresh; /* window is currently refreshed */
00024     struct node *n;
00025     struct ws_bitmap *bg; /* data below this window (if NULL, just the
00026                           background */
00027     struct ws_bitmap *in; /* data in the window (for shrink) */
00028     struct list buttonlist; /* buttons in the window */
00029 };
00030 
00031 struct wi_button {
00032     struct w_button b;
00033     struct node *n;
00034     int sys_button; /* 1 if system button, 0 if user button */
00035     int activated; /* 1 if activated, 0 otherwise */
00036     int drawn; /* 1 if button is on the screen, 0 otherwise */
00037     int tobechanged; /* 1 if the button can be clicked, 0 otherwise */
00038     /* the difference between drawn & activated:
00039        if activated==0 the button is drawn with special marker and can't be
00040        used but takes the clicking place.
00041        if drawn==0 the button is not drawn and can't be used and doesn't take
00042        any clicking place */
00043     struct ws_bitmap *bm; /* the content of the window */
00044 };
00045 
00046 struct wi_menu {
00047     char *txt, *help, hotkey;
00048     void (*action)(int);
00049     int actionnr;
00050     struct list submenus;
00051     int x1, y1, xs, ys, hklinex, hkliney, hklinexs;
00052     int level; /* submenu level. 0 is menuline */
00053     struct ws_bitmap *bm; /* bitmap covered by submenu */
00054 };
